definition: to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though

sentences.english: As the enemy retreated, we were ordered to disengage.
sentences.chinese: 當敵人退卻時我們受命撤出戰鬥。

sentences.english: We won’t retreat in the face of any threats.
sentences.chinese: 我們不會在任何威脅面前退卻。

sentences.english: RETREAT】The enemy retreated before the advance of our soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 敵軍在我們士兵的進攻下退卻了。

sentences.english: The strategy of appeasement and retreat simply doesn't work.
sentences.chinese: 緩和與退卻的戰略根本不起作用。

sentences.english: His ideology of global jihad has also retreated.
sentences.chinese: 他的全球聖戰思想也正在退卻。

sentences.english: Conscience-stricken people may draw back for a while and consequently lag behind for a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 內疚抱愧的人會一時上退卻以至於一輩子落伍。

sentences.english: As the phoenix nirvana, breathtaking Cheng tongue, strong let people retreat.
sentences.chinese: 如同鳳凰涅盤，美得讓人瞠舌，強的讓人退卻。

sentences.english: The object of strategic retreat is to conserve military strength and prepare for the counter- offensive.
sentences.chinese: 戰略退卻的目的是爲了保存軍力，準備反攻。

sentences.english: Is he drawing back before the good which he can do?
sentences.chinese: 在能辦好事時難道可以退卻嗎？

sentences.english: The paladin looked up, cued to his peril only by the dark hordes themselves pulling back with Judith's arrival.
sentences.chinese: 聖騎士在黑暗陣營自動退卻時才發現茱蒂絲的危險性。

sentences.english: The reversals of the last several months have led our military to ask for 206,000 more troops.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾個月的退卻迫使軍方要求增加二十萬六千兵員。

sentences.english: When about to withdraw, you must ponder the retreat route.
sentences.chinese: 退卻的時侯，也一定要預先考慮好後退的方案。

sentences.english: The retreat of the accepted Big Other accounts for the prevalence of code-cracking in popular culture.
sentences.chinese: 公認大他者的退卻解釋了流行文化中破解密文的盛行。

sentences.english: However, the Pakistani government and people haven’t retreated.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦政府和人民沒有退卻。

sentences.english: Check it off and feel the past receding.
sentences.chinese: 劃掉它並且感受過去正在退卻。

sentences.english: The enemy's retreat left marks of haste.
sentences.chinese: 敵軍留下了倉皇退卻的痕跡。

definition: lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
to be reluctant to give up a post
to turn a blind eye to
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to apply to/to put into (practice etc)/to put to (a test, a vote etc)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
